page.title: 01Thames Side North of Henley
page.content: The unique feature of this area, falling within Buckinghamshire, Berks and Oxfordshire, is the Henley Royal Regatta Course on the River Thames. To the west of the river lie Phyllis Court, a residential country club, and Fawley Court, a stately home used as a private school. Parkland and recreational grounds stretch between them along the A4155 where re caravan sites, a garden centre and the sewage works. In the South West the A4155 meets the A423 in residential area including small shops. hotel and post office. The major sector, to the east of the river, is mainly arable land on Remenham Hill with some woodland. The hillside gives panoraamic views of the river and Chiltern Hills. the riverside village of Remenham consists of farm, church, church hall and a few private houses.
